title.narrative: PRESCHOOL STANDARDS AND LEGISLATION

description.narrative: New Element, which contributes to Access To Quality Learning Opportunities, Cross Sectoral - Children With Disabilities, Learning, Skills, Participation And Engagement. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: New Element

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: New Element

description.narrative: UNICEF launched partnership projects with the Ministry of Education and Science and its Teacher Professional Development Centre to support implementation of the Law on Early and Preschool Education and Care and national preschool education standards by strengthening coordination and communication between the Ministry and the municipalities and creating innovative approaches for strengthening preschools for meeting the national standards. Along with continued advocacy for improved continuous professional development for preschool educators, UNICEF supported 9 state universities in finalizing bachelor-level pre-service training programmes for prospective preschool educators. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:31/12/2021

System Strengthening - Education sector planning - Existence of national strategies to address inequities in education access, participation and retention - score (1-4), see guidance (22-01-L3-27), Text

target.value: 2025:Alternative preschool services provided in municipalities in accordance to preschool strategy

actual.value: 2021:Ministry initiated process of developing a new education strategy, covering 10 years, which covers preschool education. However preschool education needs to be more precise and actionable.
